verses.roman:
vāsudeva gīte kare prabhura varṇane
kāṣṭha-pāṣāṇa drave yāhāra śravaṇe

synonyms: vāsudeva—of the name Vāsudeva; gīte—while singing; kare—does; prabhura—of Nityānanda Prabhu and Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; varṇane—in description; kāṣṭha—wood; pāṣāṇa—stone; drave—melt; yāhāra—whose; śravaṇe—by hearing.
translation: When Vāsudeva Ghoṣa performed kīrtana, describing Lord Caitanya and Nityānanda, even wood and stone would melt upon hearing it.
